block.p: Elizabeth Suzanne Toll, a daughter of Robbi S. Toll and Bruce E. Toll of Rydal, Pa., is to be married today to Leonard Mark Tannenbaum, a son of Adele Fuchsberg of Great Neck, N.Y., and Calvin M. Tannenbaum of New York. Rabbi Mordecai Waxman is to perform the ceremony at the Ritz-Carlton in Philadelphia.

The bride, 25, graduated from Boston University. She is a project manager in Armonk, N.Y., for Toll Brothers Inc., the home builder. Her father is the chairman of Toll Brothers, in Huntingdon Valley, Pa., and the chairman of Puresyn Inc., a maker of purification systems in Malvern, Pa. Her mother owns RST Design, an interior design company in Huntingdon Valley.

Elizabeth Suzanne Toll, a daughter of Robbi S. Toll and Bruce E. Toll of Rydal, Pa., is to be married today to Leonard Mark Tannenbaum, a son of Adele Fuchsberg of Great Neck, N.Y., and Calvin M. Tannenbaum of New York. Rabbi Mordecai Waxman is to perform the ceremony at the Ritz-Carlton in Philadelphia.

The bride, 25, graduated from Boston University. She is a project manager in Armonk, N.Y., for Toll Brothers Inc., the home builder. Her father is the chairman of Toll Brothers, in Huntingdon Valley, Pa., and the chairman of Puresyn Inc., a maker of purification systems in Malvern, Pa. Her mother owns RST Design, an interior design company in Huntingdon Valley.

Mr. Tannenbaum, 25, graduated and received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania. He is a partner in LAR Management, an asset management concern in New York. His mother is a district administrator for the Nassau County Board of Cooperative Educational Services in Carle Place, N.Y. His father is a managing partner of Brecher, Fishman, Feit, Heller, Rubin & Tannenbaum, a law firm in New York.
